pageContext.claim: “I saw last night where some people were talking about criminal justice reform -- very liberal Democrats. I'm the one that got it done. … If you take a look at that reform package, without Donald Trump, it doesn't happen. And you know what? I don't need the credit. I get enough credit. But they never even mention my name.”
pageContext.analysis: The First Step Act cut prison sentences for crack cocaine and reduced mandatory minimum sentences for nonviolent offenses, among other measures. The legislation and Trump's hand in it was widely covered by major media throughout the legislative process. Trump says he's the one who "got it done," and although the First Step Act is significant, one of its core pieces builds on what President Barack Obama and lawmakers enacted in 2010.
